result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Mackenzie Renner
Status hearing on August 17, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
EFFECTIVE DATE OF THIS ASSIGNMENT IS AUGUST 1, 2022.

Defendant Lisa J Pipp not in court.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by DDA Sempf. Attorney MacKenzie Renner appears specially to address appointment of Counsel. Called @ 3:49 p.m. Appearances made. Matter before the court for first status. Record by Atty. Renner as to non-appearance of defendant and status of appointment of counsel. State has no objection to resetting matter out for appointment of Counsel. Court informs parties that matter will reassigned at this time and will be scheduled on the assigned judge's calendar. Atty. Renner asks that Clerk email the clerical staff at SPD's office when date is set and NOT her. Court grants request. Court in recess.
Matter was scheduled for today at the arraignment, but Court date was not entered after the hearing.  Court sets matter out to June 16, 2022 @ 3:00 p.m. for status hearing.
Scheduling Order will be provided to Attys via e-filing by the Court

Prosecuting attorney J J. Crawford in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lisa J Pipp in court.  Attorney Leah Selmek in court for Lisa J Pipp. Not guilty plea entered and trial reserved. Minutes filed.
Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: with Exhibit #1 attached

3:51 PM  (64-06)Defendant Lisa J Pipp appeared in court, Attorney Leah Selmek for Lisa J Pipp appeared in court, Attorney Andrew Herrmann for State of Wisconsin appeared in court. 
State called to the stand as a witness Deputy Ludowise.
Mathew Ludowise duly sworn and testified on direct examination of ADA Herrmann. Witness identified the defendant in court. Exhibit #1 marked, identified and discussed. Exhibit #1 offered and received by the Court.
Cross examination by Attorney Selmek.
Argument by ADA Herrmann.
Attorney Selmek withheld argument.
Court finds probable cause that a felony has been committed and that the defendant likely committed it and binds her over to stand trial on the charges. 
State is requesting two weeks for Arraignment Hearing.
Arraignment scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
